New Records: Harry Kane has a national record-extending 63rd goal for England
Key Match Events: Germany's 21-year-old forward Maximilian Beier almost scored with his first shot in international soccer, striking the underside of the bar in the 60th minute
Trent Alexander-Arnold scored with a volleyed shot in the 85th minute
Lovro Majer scored twice in the first half before Germany-born Marco Pašalić got the third for Croatia
Pre-Game Insights: Germany and England kicked off the true buildup to the European Championship with their first warmup games on Monday
All three Euro 2024 contenders were without their Madrid stars — Toni Kroos, Jude Bellingham and Luka Modrić — who are resting this week after their title win on Saturday against Borussia Dortmund
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Julian Nagelsmann gave a debut to Bayern Munich’s 20-year-old midfielder Aleksandar Pavlović

England coach Gareth Southgate gave first appearances to Crystal Palace midfielder Adam Wharton — whose club teammate Eberechi Eze impressed in the first half — and Everton defender Jarrad Branthwaite
Miscellaneous Highlights: Germany’s head coach Julian Nagelsmann, left, gestures during an international friendly soccer match between Germany and Ukraine in Nuremberg, Germany, Monday, June 3, 2024

Chancellor Olaf Scholz, left, stands in the stands next to Oleksii Makeiev, right, Ukraine’s ambassador to Germany, during an international friendly soccer match between Germany and Ukraine in Nuremberg, Germany, Monday, June 3, 2024
Others: Mateo Kovacic made his 100th appearance for Croatia in a comfortable win over North Macedonia
